intro: Diacalpe annamensis, commonly known as the Annam mountain vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
